text: Veer Bahadur Singh Sports College, Gorakhpur is a residential sports college in Gorakhpur, Uttar Pradesh, established in 1988. It offers sports training in football, hockey, wrestling, athletics, badminton, swimming and kabaddi in 6th to 12th standard and with the curriculum of the U.P. Board. It is the 2nd sports college established in Uttar Pradesh after Guru Gobind Singh Sports College of Lucknow and before Etawah's Saifai Sports College. ==History== After the success of Guru Gobind Singh Sports College, Lucknow with specific contribution in the field of sports the government of Uttar Pradesh established this sports college in Gorakhpur in the year of 1988–89. ==Notable alumni== * Preeti Dubey, Indian Women's Hockey team (2016 Summer Olympics)http://upsports.gov.in/site/writereaddata/UploadedPressRelease/pdf/C_201607131751395513.pdf ==See also== *Guru Gobind Singh Sports College, Lucknow *Saifai Sports College, Saifai *Maharana Pratap Sports College, Dehradun *Motilal Nehru School of Sports, Rai, Sonipat ==External links== *Official website ==References== Category:Sport schools in India Category:Intermediate colleges in Uttar Pradesh Category:Universities and colleges in Uttar Pradesh Category:Sport in Gorakhpur Category:Education in Gorakhpur Category:Uttar Pradesh Sports Colleges Society
title: Bir Bahadur Singh Sports College, Gorakhpur
